Title: Ukraine launched production of 155-mm artillery shells, official says
Description: Ukraine already produces its own 155 mm artillery ammunition, said Oleksandr Kamyshin, newly appointed advisor to the President of Ukraine on strategic issues.

Title: Germany won't allow long-range strikes on Russia even if other countries do, Scholz says
Description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said that Berlin 'will continue to support Ukraine militarily' so that the country 'does not collapse,' German media Welt reported.

Title: ATACMS restrictions subject of 'intense consultations' between Ukraine and allies, Sullivan says
Description: ATACMS restrictions are 'the subject of intense consultation among allies and partners, and will be (discussed) between President (Biden) and President Zelensky,' U.S. National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan said.

Title: From strangers to friends: How Ukrainians meet and bond during wartime train travel
Description: For the past eight years, Anton Lytvynov, a stage director at Lviv National Opera, has celebrated New Year in Kyiv with his three friends – Sandra, Mykhailo, and Volodymyr. However, on Dec. 31, 2022, work commitments kept Lytvynov in Lviv longer than he had expected. Determined to reunite with his

Title: 3 killed in Russian attack on Zaporizhzhia Oblast, governor says
Description: Zaporizhzhia Oblast Governor Ivan Fedorov said that Russian forces struck the territory of an agricultural enterprise, without specifying the type of weapon used.

Title: 103 Ukrainian POWs returned from Russian captivity, including 23 Azov fighters
Description: The vast majority of those released are people who had been held (in captivity) since the first days of the war,' said Ukraine's Ombudsman Dmytro Lubinets in a statement.

Title: Discovering the majesty of the Carpathians | Dare to Ukraine
Description: In the second episode of 'Dare to Ukraine,' we venture into the breathtaking Carpathian Mountains, a region known for its majestic landscapes, deep-rooted traditions, and rich cultural heritage.

Title: Russian attacks against Ukraine kill at least 6, injure 25 over past day
Description: Ukrainian air defenses shot down 72 of the 76 Shahed-type drones launched by Russia overnight, the Air Force reported.

Title: NATO could have done more to stop Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine, Stoltenberg says
Description: Stoltenberg said the day the war was launched was the worst in his 10-year stint in the role, from which he is stepping down next month.

Title: Ukraine's long-range missile strike hopes on hold once again but encouraging signs remain
Description: Ukraine's hopes of being allowed to use Western-supplied long range missiles to strike deep inside Russian territory were put on hold once again on Sept. 13, after the leaders of the U.S. and U.K. stopped short of making the announcement Kyiv wanted. Anticipation had been high

Title: Zelensky reveals details of July call with Trump, says he claimed to be 'very supportive'
Description: My position is that the election period and election messages are election messages. Sometimes they are not very real,' Zelensky said during a clip of the CNN interview, which is set to be fully published on Sept. 15.

Title: General Staff: Russia has lost 632,630 troops since Feb. 24, 2022
Description: This number includes 1,210 casualties Russian forces suffered over the past day.

Title: Red Cross says it has suspended operations at Dnipro office following attack that killed, injured employees
Description: A spokesperson for the Ukrainian delegation of the International Committee of the Red Cross says that the organization has suspended operations at its Dnipro office after three of its employees were killed in a strike on Sept. 12.

Title: Ukraine's chief rabbi mourns loss of adopted son, killed in combat
Description: On Thursday, a memorial service was held in Kyiv for Anton Samborskyi, the adopted son of Ukraine's Chief Rabbi Moshe Azman, who was killed in combat.

Title: US warns RT is directly involved in Russian intelligence operations
Description: (RT) is also engaged in information operations, covert influence, and military procurement. These operations are targeting countries around the world, including in Europe, Africa, and North and South America,' the State Department said.
